article: Soon it would be the holidays, but before that, there were final _ . All the kids had been working hard for some time, reviewing their _ . If they didn't pass the exams, they would have to _ them in September. There were usually a few who _ , but Jane didn't want to be one of them. She had worked hard all year, but she was working so hard that her mother worried about her. She went to bed too late. The night before the big day, her mother _ that she should have an early night and take a sleeping pill. She promised to _ her up in the morning. Jane was too _ to fall asleep. Her mind kept jumping from subject to subject. At last, the _ did work. In no time at all, she was sitting in the examination hall, looking at the paper, but she couldn't answer _ of the questions. Everyone around her was writing pages and pages. _ , she couldn't find anything to write about. From time to time she looked at her _ . Time was running _ . There was only an hour to _ . She started one question, wrote two sentences, gave up and tried another. With only half an hour left she wrote another two sentences. By this time she was so worried that she started _ . Her whole body shook. It shook so much that she woke up. She was still in bed and it had all been a terrible _ . A minute later, her mother called her name.
